title: Drawing, "Sepulchral Monument for Roman Cavina, Chiesa dell'Osservanza, Faenza", 1816
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over graphite on white heavy wove paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink, on sarcophagus: ROMANO CAVINA; on plinth: HUIC PIETA - FEDE MARITALE
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Sarcophagus in niche; on it, bas-relief portrait medallion of Romano Cavina. Seated on plinth at lower left, female figure of Abundance, holding cornucopia and embracing child; standing female figure mourns at right.

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource
